# build: simplify lua file discovery with manifest script

Replace complex shell pipeline with dedicated Lua script for finding Lua files in the build system.

## Changes

- `lib/build/manifest.lua` - iterator-based file discovery via git ls-files
  - `files()` iterator returns file info with type, is_test, is_check flags
  - `find_lua_files()` returns lua files respecting --check:false tags
  - `find_lua_tests()` returns test files respecting --test:false and --check:false tags
  - detects file types via extension and shebang patterns
  - `--test:false` tag excludes files from test runs
  - `--check:false` tag excludes files from ast-grep/luacheck/teal checks

- Config files tagged with `--check:false`:
  - hammerspoon: init, dispatch, emoji-picker, symbol-picker, superwhisper
  - nvim: init.lua, lua/work/init.lua

- `Makefile` - use manifest script instead of complex shell pipeline

## Validation

- [x] `make check` passes (220 files, 0 failures)
- [x] `make test` runs correctly
- [x] incremental builds work (unchanged files not rechecked)
- [x] tagged files correctly excluded from checks
